str2: Adverb from a compound of the base of homou and thumos; unanimously.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To persist, persevere in, continue steadfast in; I wait upon.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
